title: Historic Orange County
name: Historic Orange County
description:
A Map by Spaceagecity

A few of the many sites of historical importance in Orange County, California.

properties.name: Anaheim Museum
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity   241 S. Anaheim Blvd., Anaheim, CA 92805Designed by architect John C. Austin, and dedicated in 1908, Anaheim\'s old Carnegie Library is now a museum with artifacts and exhibits highlighting the history of the City and the surrounding area.

properties.name: Balboa Pavilion
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity400 Main St., Balboa, CA 92661Built in 1905. Is on the National Register of Historic Places and is California Historical Landmark #959.

properties.name: Birthplace of President Richard M. Nixon
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity 18001 Yorba Linda Blvd, Yorba Linda, CA 92886This small white farmhouse was built by the President\'s father, Frank Nixon in 1912. Richard Nixon was born here on Jan. 9, 1913. The house is now surrounded by the The Richard Nixon Library & Birthplace -- a museum and archives that provide information about the "events, people and world that shaped, and were shaped by, the 37th President." Both Richard and Pat Nixon are buried on the grounds.

properties.name: Evangeline Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity  421 8th St., Huntington Beach, CAThis three-story, craftsman-style hotel was built around 1905, when it was somewhat by itself on the northwestern outskirts of town. Decades later, the Evangeline Hotel became the Colonial Inn Rooming House, and later the Colonial Inn Hostel.

properties.name: Huntington Beach High School
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity   1905 Main Street, Huntington Beach, CA 92648 Designed by Allison & Allison and built in 1928, HBHS is an example of Romanesque Revival architecture.

properties.name: Lovell Beach House
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity   1242 W. Ocean Front, Balboa, CA 92661Designed for the Lovell family by architect Rudolf M. Schindler and completed in 1926, this beach house was the building that introduced European modernism to America. It is one of the most arcitecturally significant buildings in Southern California and is on the National Register of Historic Places. (Note: This is a private residence. Please do not disturb the occupants.)

properties.name: Mission San Juan Capistrano
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity26801 Ortega Hwy, San Juan Capistrano, CA 92675The seventh in California\'s Spanish mission chain, Mission San Juan Capistrano was dedicated in 1776 by Fr. Junipero Serra. Serra Chapel is considered the oldest church in California. It is on the National Register of Historic Places and is California State Historical Landmark #200. Tradition holds the swallows return here each year as part of their migration.

properties.name: Old Orange County Courthouse
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity  211 W. Santa Ana Blvd, Santa Ana, CA 92701Built in 1901, this granite and sandstone courthouse is the traditional home of Orange County\'s government. Court functions were transferred to a new building in the 1960s, but the Old Courthouse continues to serve the public. Today, this landmark contains the Old Courthouse Museum, the Orange County Archives, the library of the Pacific Coast Archaeological Society, the Marriages office of the O.C. Clerk-Recorder, and other government offices. It is on the National Register of Historic places and is a State of California Historic Landmark.

properties.name: Pacific Beach Club site
properties.description: Posted by Spaceagecity   Huntington Beach, CA 92646The Pacific Beach Club was a large private beach resort for black people which was burned to the ground under mysterious circumstances just shortly before opening for business in 1926. Today, the site is part of Huntington State Beach, between Newland St. and Beach Blvd.
